title: 109_hr5413
content: The Act aims to improve the codification of title 46, United States Code, by incorporating public comments and amendments made after the cutoff date specified in a previous bill. It specifically addresses personal injury to or death of seamen. The Act amends Section 30104 of title 46, United States Code, allowing injured seamen or their representatives to bring actions for personal injury or death under US laws. Venue for such actions at law will be in the judicial district where the employer resides. Additionally, there are amendments to Chapter 537. The Act amends Section 53701 and 53706(c) of title 46, United States Code, defining the terms Administrator and Secretary, and establishing priorities for certain vessels in guaranteeing obligations. The Administrator shall prioritize vessels eligible for guarantees, giving preference to those constructed with assistance under the Maritime Security Act of 2003 and vessels suitable for naval auxiliary service in times of war or national emergency, as determined by the Secretary of Defense. The Secretary of Defense will determine if a vessel is suitable for naval auxiliary service in times of war or national emergency within 30 days of a request from the Administrator. Amendments are made to section 53707 of title 46, United States Code to reflect this determination process. Amendments are made to section 53708 of title 46, United States Code, to replace references to the Secretary of Transportation with the Administrator. Amendments to section 53708 of title 46, United States Code, replace references to the Secretary of Transportation with the Administrator and make adjustments to subsections (b) and (c) by removing references to the Department of Commerce. Subsection (d) is modified to include the option for a third-party independent analysis conducted by a private sector expert in assessing risk factors. Amendments to section 53712 of title 46, United States Code, involve inserting "or financial structures" in subsections (c) and (e), and striking certain language related to risk factors. Additionally, section 53712(b) is amended by removing the last sentence and adding requirements for loan agreements if a waiver has been granted under section 53707(d). Amendments to title 46, United States Code include changes to loan agreements when waivers are granted under section 53707(d), additional payments, collateral, or equity contributions may be required. Other sections are amended to replace "Secretary" with "Administrator." Amendments to title 46, United States Code involve replacing instances of "Secretary" with "Administrator" in various sections, and making adjustments to loan agreements under section 53707(d). Amendments to title 46, United States Code involve replacing instances of "Secretary" with "Administrator" in various sections, except when followed by "of Transportation" or "of the Treasury". Amendments to title 46, United States Code involve replacing instances of "Secretary" with "Administrator" in specific sections. Amendments to title 46, United States Code involve replacing instances of "Secretary" with "Administrator" in specific sections. SEC. 4. MISCELLANEOUS AMENDMENTS. Title 46, United States Code is amended by replacing "Naval Reserve" with "Navy Reserve" in chapters 513 and 515. Section 51504(f) is amended to specify fuel cost payments to State maritime academies, with maximum amounts set for fiscal years 2006-2008 and beyond. Section 51505(b)(2)(B) is also amended. The funding amounts for fiscal years 2006-2008 and beyond are increased in various sections of Title 46, United States Code. Additionally, the Secretary of Transportation may provide decorations, medals, and replacements as authorized. The Secretary of Transportation is authorized to provide decorations, medals, and replacements as specified in Section 51907 of Title 46, United States Code. The Secretary of Transportation is authorized to provide decorations, medals, and replacements under Chapter 541 of Title 46, United States Code. This includes assistance for small shipyards and maritime communities. Section 55101(b) is amended by inserting "or" after paragraph (2), striking paragraph (3), and redesignating paragraph (4) as paragraph (3). Section 60301 is amended to increase ton fees for fiscal years 2006 through 2010 and thereafter. The ton fees are amended to 13.5 cents per ton for fiscal years 2006 through 2010, and 6 cents per ton for each fiscal year thereafter, not exceeding a total of 67.5 cents per ton per year. SEC. 5.
